parameters.definition: Number of units of sand a small container can hold
Number of units of sand a large container can hold
Number of people required to unload a small container
Number of people required to unload a large container
Ratio of the number of small containers to the number of large containers
Minimum number of small containers used
Minimum number of large containers used
Total number of people available for unloading

description: A sand company delivers sand for playgrounds in small and large containers. A small container requires \param{SmallUnload} person to unload and can hold \param{SmallCapacity} units of sand. A large container requires \param{LargeUnload} people to unload and can hold \param{LargeCapacity} units of sand. Since most playgrounds are small, the number of small containers used must be \param{ContainerRatio} times the number of large containers used. In addition, there must be at least \param{MinSmallContainers} small containers and \param{MinLargeContainers} large containers used. If the company has \param{PeopleAvailable} people available, maximize the amount of sand that they can deliver.
